title: Abbey Clancy shows off washboard abs in sizzling snap with lookalike sister
body_text:
Abbey Clancy shows off washboard abs in sizzling snap with lookalike sister
Model and Peter Crouch's wife Abbey Clancy exposed her toned tummy when she posed in the mirror wearing a tiny crop top on a night out with her rarely-seen sister Elle
Abbey Clancy looked sensational in a stunning mirror snap taken on a night out with her lookalike sister Elle.
Peter Crouch's model wife never fails to wow fans with her glamorous looks, but on Monday (February 28) she proved this week would be no different.
Abbey, 37, showed off her killer figure and washboard abs in a tiny dark crop-top which she teamed with a pair of tight jeans highlghting her toned legs.
READ MORE: Abbey Clancy hailed 'sexiest woman in the world' as she poses topless in racy snaps
The stunner held up her phone to snap the winning mirror selfie next to 25-year-old Elle, who looked equally as glam and twinned with her sister in a crop top and jeans.
But it wasn't just that stylish sisters Abbey and Elle were wearing matching outfits, because the gorgeous pair looked incredibly alike with their long flowing locks.
Abbey oozed glamour as she flashed a pout for the camera with her hand in her pocket and leaned to the side.
She allowed her long blonde locks to spill onto her shoulders in loose wavy tresses, but the photo was coasted in a red light so the blonde didn't shine through.
Abbey recently grilled hubby Peter on their podcast The Therapy Crouch over comments he made that suggested a football game was better than the birth of their kids.
Abbey stated: "Having children doesn't even come close to the feeling you get when you play football."
Reaching for her phone, she said: "I'm actually gonna try and find this on my phone now because it was actually disgusting."
Peter replied: "Well this is something you know that we come across, I think when you are potentially in the public eye, you know stories and words can be misconstrued hopefully."
Abbey then read out a news headline: "Peter Crouch says getting to the Champions League final was better than the birth of his kids."
Turning to Peter, she fumed: "Three days ago you said this."
"Yeah but I obviously said it a while ago, they just put it in three days ago," defended Peter before admitting he "loosely" said it.
